This is my suggestion:

1. Add colored nicknames for team players to facilitate identifying teammates.

2. Add a PVP immunity feature for team players.

3. Enable the voice chat function.

Mojang can you please add a proximity chat for when people are in a party together because me and my friends all play different versions and it really sucks when you can't play with a mobile player when Minecraft disconnects there discord call or there Xbox party it really is annoying typing in chat. a way I thought you could do this is when the player joins the party and they have a mic plugged up you will be able to talk to each other. this will also help with cross play talking as well but I don't know how you would implement this into servers though.

This feature will make playing on featured servers with friends much easier. The only thing I suggest is these two ideas:

  • The ability to chat privately with everyone in the group using either the regular in-game chat or some other system.
  • The ability to personalize the party like adding a banner or profile picture would be nice.

this change is even more eye straining than it was before, and no toggle option is just unacceptable.

I definitely agree. The old smooth movement never gave me any trouble, but the new style makes the movement of the camera and the movement of my actual character feel detached from each other. I'd have no complaint if this was a new option, but forcing the change on all users seems like a mistake.
Agreed. The new camera movement genuinely made me motion sick, to the point that I had to go lay down after a few minutes of testing it.
The new change definitely causes more eye strain for me, it at least needs a rework, if not just removed.

My daughter is deaf and cannot hear the sounds in Minecraft Bedrock Edition. While she loves playing the game, the lack of subtitles makes it difficult for her to fully enjoy and engage with the experience. Adding subtitles would not only make the game more accessible for her, but also for many other players in the deaf and hard-of-hearing community. Accessibility features like this ensure that everyone can participate equally and feel included in the Minecraft world.  Thank you for taking the time to consider this request. I truly appreciate your commitment to making Minecraft a welcoming and inclusive experience for all players, and I hope you will explore adding subtitles to Minecraft Bedrock Edition
